name: pika
title: How much programming do you know?
introduction:
PIKA: Prior Informatics Knowledge Assessment 2025

This test is a survey of the programming knowledge that students have when they begin higher education. The results of this test will be used to improve the teaching of programming.

The test is not used to evaluate you and will not affect your grade in the course. Your answers to the test questions are anonymous and we will not store any identifier such as your name or student number. Participation is voluntary.

The Introduction to Programming course you are about to start will be taught from scratch, regardless of how well you do on this test :)
thanks: Thank you for responding! If you want to see your score later you can bookmark this.
questions_text: If you have any questions, please contact

error.name: An error will occur when running

errors.no_value: Choose a type for the value

value.array: Fill in a list av integers seperated by commas. For example: 1, 2, 3
value.string: Fill in a string, either with or without quotation marks.
value.dict: Fill in a dictionary in the given format.
value.null: Fältet måste vara tomt eftersom du har valt None som typ
value.unknown: The field must be empty as you have chosen "I don't know"
value.nothing: Fältet måste vara tomt eftersom du har valt att variabeln inte finns

guidelines.text:
This test must be completed without the use of aids. Communication with others and the use of external resources such as the internet, books, printouts, etc. are not permitted.

The only tools allowed are pen and paper.

institution.caption: At what institution are you currently studying?
options: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
Western Norway University of Applied Sciences (HVL)

gender.caption: What gender do you identify as?

prev_done.caption: When did you finish secondary school (high school)?

math_courses.caption: What math subjects did you complete in secondary school (high school)?

stem_courses.caption: What STEM subjects did you complete in secondary school (high school)?

prog_courses.caption: Have you completed any of the following elective programming subjects?

other_experience.caption: Do you have experience with programming outside of school?
other_experience.text:
Block based programming includes Scratch, Blockly, etc.
Text based programming includes Python, Java, C, C#, C++, etc.
options: I have no experience outside of school
At least 30 hours experience with text based programming
At least 50 hours experience with text based programming
At least 100 hours experience with text based programming
More than 120 hours experience with text based programming
At least 30 hours experience with block based programming
At least 50 hours experience with block based programming
At least 100 hours experience with block based programming
More than 120 hours experience with block based programming

uni_course.caption: Have you participated or completed a programming/computer science course in higher education before this test? This does not inlcude the course you are currently taking.
options: Yes, a course which awarded 10 study points (ECTS)
Yes, a course which awarded 7.5 study points (ECTS)
Yes, a course which awarded 5 study points (ECTS)
Yes, but the course did not award any study points (ECTS)

instructions.caption: Programming tasks
instructions.text:
The next section contains programming tasks that are about the Python programming language.

If you think you know the answer, or have a clue what the answer might be, we want you to provide an answer.

Important

If you have no idea what the answer might be, select "I don't know". Remember, this test is not designed to evaluate you specifically. It is meant to map the general programming knowledge of incoming students, so please don't try to make lucky guesses. Rather choose "I don't know."
